name: Into the Chasm - Chasm-002
tagline: in which the maze shifts, the dead speak, and a white beast answers the call
shortSummary: The party pushes deeper into Zeyfa’s Labyrinth, surviving a warm crevasse and worsening storm, questioning a dead man from Melusa, and emerging into a stormless black-stone chamber where a shaggy white beast finally appears.
longSummary: Exploring Zeyfa’s shifting corridors, the party reaches a low ice-walled chamber split by a warm crevasse fringed with ice “ferns,” and their attempts to probe and cross it trigger rising wind, denser snow, and moments of disorientation and danger. They press on to a frozen corpse and use Speak with Dead to learn of Melusa—an isolated cliffside village that offers sacrifices to Zeyfa—while the dead insist the labyrinth does not let stories (or souls) escape. Finnan’s Memory of the Ancestors connects Melusa to old Teft-travel stories of a waterfall shrine tied to a kestavo called Melua, as the maze continues to rearrange itself around them amid booming pulses and wind-creatures. Fleeing collapsing ice and an avalanche-like surge, they slide into darkness and drop into a quiet black-stone chamber, where Kalima warns a beast is near and a towering white monster answers Justas’s challenge.

npcs.name: Kalima
npcs.notes: Terrified Zimkovan woman who names their prison Zeyfa’s Labyrinth; injured during the booming storm corridors and increasingly fearful of the kenku.

npcs.name: Rolla
npcs.notes: Jrain’s avian companion used for scouting and situational help.

npcs.name: Unnamed man of Melusa
npcs.notes: Dead villager trapped in ice; questioned via Speak with Dead about Melusa, Zeyfa’s minion, and escape.

npcs.name: Zeyfa
npcs.notes: Cruel West Wind of Zimkovan/kestavo lore, said to rule the labyrinth and demand sacrifices.

npcs.name: Melua
npcs.notes: A kestavo associated (by Finnan’s remembered stories) with an old waterfall shrine on the upper Teft; possibly linguistically linked to Melusa.

npcs.name: Romil the Glacier King
npcs.notes: Name invoked by Kalima in prayer and associated with the glacial light she clutches.

places.name: Zeyfa's Labyrinth
places.notes: The shifting ice-and-stone maze in which the party is trapped.

places.name: Great Chasm
places.notes: Referenced for comparison and lore; Ekko compares the labyrinth’s feel to the Chasm.

places.name: Teft
places.notes: River referenced in Finnan’s remembered stories connected to an old waterfall shrine and Melua.

places.name: Melusa
places.notes: Cliffside village named by the dead; described as the only village its people know, carved into ice with a river running through it.

places.name: Sentinel Range
places.notes: Referenced when comparing local stone to familiar mountain rock.

treasure: Plain silver ring worn on a necklace
